com.busit

Interface IContent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Jsonizable, Map<String,Object>

    public interface IContent
extends Map<String,Object>, Jsonizable
    This interface defines the properties of a message content. See this as a kind of loose multi-field type wrapper around any sort of data. Give it a nice name(), a ideally unique id() and you have your own custom data type.
    Note:
    all properties contained via the Map interface must be json compatible. That is, if you set a random Object or another IContent as value, it will be converted to its closest json representation but will not be interpreted as the same type of Object when reading it afterwards.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface Map

        Map.Entry<K,V>

      • textFormat

        String textFormat()
        Get the simple text format template
        Returns:
        the simple text format

      • textFormat

        void textFormat(String format)
        Set the simple text format template. The template will be used by the toText() method to print a nice formatted text with substituted values.
        The substituable parts should be enclosed in double curly braces : {{value}} and the value should be the name of a property stored in this content type. In order to access nested properties (sub-map or sub-array), you should separate values by a single dot.
        Data representation in JSON: 
         {
     "contacts": [
         { "name": "sam" },
         { "name": "yann" },
         { "name": "simon" }
     ]
 }

        Sample format text: 
        "The first contact name is : {{contacts.0.name}}"
        If the value is not found, the substitution group is ignored and replaced by an empty string.
        Parameters:
        format - the format template

      • toText

        String toText()
        Get a simple text formatted string representation of the data
        Returns:
        simple text data

        Returns:

      • htmlFormat

        String htmlFormat()
        Get the html format template
        Returns:
        the html format

      • htmlFormat

        void htmlFormat(String format)
        Set the html format template. The template will be used by the toHtml() method to print a nice formatted text with substituted values.
        The substituable parts should be enclosed in double curly braces : {{value}} and the value should be the name of a property stored in this content type. In order to access nested properties (sub-map or sub-array), you should separate values by a single dot.
        Beware that in order to avoid malicious scripting or invasive content, some tags are ignored such as (non-exhaustive) script, object, embed.
        Data representation in JSON: 
         {
     "contacts": [
         { "name": "sam" },
         { "name": "yann" },
         { "name": "simon" }
     ]
 }

        Sample format text: 
        "The [b]first[/b] contact name is : [i]{{contacts.0.name}}[/i]"
        If the value is not found, the substitution group is ignored and replaced by an empty string.
        Parameters:
        format - the format template

      • toHtml

        String toHtml()
        Get a html formatted string representation of the data
        Returns:
        html data

      • toHtml

        String toHtml(String format)
        Get a html formatted string representation of the data using the specified format
        Parameters:
        format - the format to apply
        Returns:
        html data

      • merge

        void merge(IContent content)
        Merges all properties of the specified content type into this one. All compatibilities of the merged content type will be copied. The name, id, textFormat and htmlFormat of the current content type will not be altered.
        Parameters:
        content - the content type to merge into this one
